abstract: The founder of a women’s apparel and accessories business said she posted surprise coupons, ran sales two nights a week and made sure she had a customer service representative available on sale nights.

lead_paragraph: In my last post, I talked about how Ashley White, founder of the Polkadot Alley, turned around her business by using Facebook not just as a marketing tool but as a place to make sales. This post is about the techniques she used to increase those sales to $1.5 million a year from $400,000.

headline.main: How to Run a Facebook Commerce Store
